text: I totally, totally agree with what you say about home/hybrid working. I hate that some employers are just going back to 'normal' when there's absolutely no need for it whatsoever. Not having to waste money and time on commuting makes life so much easier and gives a far better balance. And for me it feeds my soul to be in my own surroundings and not in a soulless office. So where your job can be done from home and your own situation makes it possible or desirable then it should be made possible by employers.

text: Lydia, your outfits in this Vlog are lovely on you (as always)! but you haven't put together an outfit other than with your mini kelly . What about those lovely straw bags you were on the hunt for last year? They would look great with these feminine dresses, as well as your gold and straw Chanel. I loved how you wrapped a twilly around one inexpensive Amazon straw bag! It's summer! Enjoy your other bags and sandals! You also limit your shoe choices by having to match the leather. Not all your followers can afford Hermes, as they are 5 figures, (over 10k) so while Hermes is a beautiful brand, it would be more interesting to incorporate others as inspiration and ideas for designers that are more obtainable. I understand you are getting a lot of use for wear

text: I'm sorry to say that l had to give my Dachshund away he was chocolate brown 2 years old his name was Beauregard, Beau for short. My family and l have all owned Sausage dogs since 1960. My husband became a alcoholic l was working and he refused to look after Beau, l had no choice but to rehome him. He went to a really nice family they said l could visit but it was far to upsetting for me. That was six years ago, my husband passed away five years ago in bad circumstances. Very sad, l do inquire every now and again to see if Beau is OK, gladly he is very happy and they love him. Quiet a sad story really but l do have a gorgeous, funny and loving ginger tom cat called Leo. So Lydia when l watched your utube video and the dream l understand...Jane...

text: With all due respect Lydia, good things don't always happen to good people. This is the 3rd time you've made this statement in one of your videos and I cringe every time you say it. There is a war going on in the Ukraine and millions are being killed, and I'm sure they are all good people. There was a HORRIFIC evil event that happened in the states where a gunman killed 25 innocent children and some teachers. We all know that they are good people. Last year a dear friend of mine, who was really like an angel, one of the most incredible people you ever could meet was killed in a horrible terrifying accident - she was a really good person. If good things happen to good people, then bad things happen to bad people and...well...I'm sure I don't have to name some horrible well known people who get awards, millions and a seemingly have a great love life.  Just saying... Love you girl, but please know that this statement is BEYOND false. You seem to be a good person, and you lost your beautiful little Lynx. That was not a good thing.
